meanings.definition: To shock or excite someone into taking action.
meanings.sent1: The thrilling movie ending galvanized the audience, making them cheer loudly.
meanings.sent2: The inspiring speech galvanized the community to come together and help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the story was so galvanizing that everyone gasped in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate plea for change was a galvanizing force that sparked a movement.
meanings.sent5: The urgent call for help was so galvanizing that people immediately sprang into action.

meanings.definition: To coat iron or steel with a protective layer of zinc.
meanings.sent1: The workers were galvanizing the metal beams to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to galvanize the fence to make it more durable against the weather.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that they should galvanize their tools to protect them from wear and tear.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a unique technique to galvanize the sculpture and give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent5: The engineer explained the process of galvanizing to the students, showing them how it protects the metal.

meanings.sent1: The energetic music galvanized the crowd, getting everyone on their feet and dancing.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can galvanize you for the challenges of the day ahead.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh coffee in the morning is always galvanizing, waking you up instantly.
meanings.sent4: The coach's pep talk before the game was a galvanizing moment for the team.
meanings.sent5: The positive feedback from her boss galvanized her to work even harder on the project.
